snippet: The Supreme Court bolstered public support for President Obama’s health care law while hurting its own reputation.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column looks at study by Prof Andrea Campbell and Nathaniel Persily, who found that by bolstering public support for Pres Obama's health care law, the Supreme Court hurt its own reputation; notes that this complicated and unusual reaction may affect public approval of the justices' future decisions.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court bolstered public support for President Obama’s health care law while hurting its own reputation.

headline.print_headline: Health Care Case Helped Law but Hurt Supreme Court, Study Finds
headline.seo: Reaction to Supreme Court’s Health Decision a Rarity, Study Finds
headline.main: Health Care Case Is Seen as Helping Law but Hurting Court

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
